snippet: Officials are focusing on automobile emissions in their battle to improve air quality, but residents point to a sprawling city where a car is necessary.
abstract: Mexico City Journal; air pollution has returned as urgent issue in Mexico City following long period of progress since 1980s; government has imposed rules that keep roughly 20 percent of metropolitan area's five million cars grounded on daily basis; focus on automotive pollution has frustrated residents who say car travel is essential.
lead_paragraph: Officials are focusing on automobile emissions in their battle to improve air quality, but residents point to a sprawling city where a car is necessary.

headline.print_headline: Pollution Returns to a City Where Not Driving Is Hardly an Option
headline.main: Haze Returns to Mexico City, Where Not Driving Is Hardly an Option
